Lasitha Ranatunga wrote:

>  > From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
>  > Sent: Thursday, November 20, 2003 5:47 PM
>  >
>  > Lasitha Ranatunga wrote:
>  >
>  > > I've been solving this kind of duplication by creating my own
>  > > assertions.  As an example, see my version of CalculateAgeTest
>  > > below.  I'm curious about the pros/cons of each approach?
>  >
>  > You're adding a new test method for each test. I'm just adding data.
>  > I could externalize the test data to a file and add tests without
>  > writing code.  That's the big difference.
> 
> I see.  A quick attempt at externalizing the data in my example shows
> it can be done, but my tests stop at the first failed assertion. Yours
> is a better solution when there are enough data-sets to warrant
> externalizing them.

Absolutely. It's something I struggled on for a while: I didn't want to 
write all that duplicate code (test methods), but I also wanted each 
test to execute on its own as a test.

Take care.
